Serialized Form

  • Package gameComponents

    • Class gameComponents.CurvedMirror extends Mirror implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      4657868968094799031L

      • Serialized Fields

        • radius

          int radius
          Radius of the circle equation representing this curved mirror

        • h

          double h
          X coordinate of the circle equation called h by convention

        • k

          double k
          Y coordinate of the circle equation called k by convention

        • convergent

          boolean convergent
          Tells whether the mirror is convergent (true) or divergent (false). A convergent mirror has its reflective side towards its center, while a divergent mirror has its reflective side pointing outwards

        • arcAngle

          double arcAngle
          The angle from the horizontal to the first end point of the arc representing the mirror

        • arcAngleb

          double arcAngleb
          The angle from the horizontal to the second end point of the arc representing the mirror

        • arcLength

          double arcLength
          The length of the arc representing the curved mirror, specified in degrees

    • Class gameComponents.GameComponent extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -3553956612400520952L

      • Serialized Fields

        • position

          java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double position
          Locates the component on the 2D plane

        • color

          java.awt.Color color

        • moveable

          boolean moveable

        • resizeable

          boolean resizeable

        • rotateable

          boolean rotateable

        • selecteable

          boolean selecteable

        • selected

          boolean selected

        • bounds

          double[] bounds
          Delimits the contours of a component; (bounds[0], bounds[1]) is the top left corner and (bounds[2], bounds[3]) is the lower right corner

        • box

          java.awt.Rectangle box
          The bounds of the component in the form of a rectangle

        • BIG

          int BIG
          A useful constant, to simulate points/slopes of infinite values

    • Class gameComponents.Lens extends RefractiveZone implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -7377177913826834933L

      • Serialized Fields

        • radius

          double radius
          Radius for the circles of surface 1 and surface 2

        • h1

          double h1
          The x coordinate of the circle equation of surface 1

        • h2

          double h2
          The x coordinate of the circle equation of surface 2

        • k1

          double k1
          The y coordinate of the circle equation of surface 1

        • k2

          double k2
          The y coordinate of the circle equation of surface 2

        • h

          double h

        • k

          double k

        • arcAngle

          double arcAngle

        • arcAngleb

          double arcAngleb

        • arcAngle1

          double arcAngle1

        • arcAngleb1

          double arcAngleb1

        • arcAngleb2

          double arcAngleb2

        • arcAngle2

          double arcAngle2

        • arcLength1

          double arcLength1
          The length of the arc representing the first surface of the lens specified in degrees, values between 30 and 180

        • arcLength2

          double arcLength2
          The length of the arc representing the second surface of the lens specified in degrees, values between 30 and 180

        • leaving

          boolean leaving
          Keeps track of whether the incident ray is coming into the lens (false) or going out (true)

        • dx

          double dx
          Horizontal distance between the 2 surfaces of the lens. Helps to fix the surfaces together

        • dy

          double dy
          Vertical distance between the 2 surfaces of the lens. Helps to fix the surfaces together

    • Class gameComponents.Mirror extends OpticalObject implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2980938889237079064L

      • Serialized Fields

        • angle

          double angle
          The angle from the horizontal to the bounding point (b[0], b[1])

        • length

          double length
          Length of the plane mirror

        • orientation

          int orientation
          The orientation can take the values: NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST, Q1, Q2, Q3 or Q4. It is the direction that the reflective side of the mirror is facing

        • NORTH

          int NORTH
          Orientation facing up

        • EAST

          int EAST
          Orientation facing right

        • SOUTH

          int SOUTH
          Orientation facing down

        • WEST

          int WEST
          Orientation facing left

        • Q1

          int Q1
          Orientation facing first quadrant of the Cartesian plane

        • Q2

          int Q2
          Orientation facing second quadrant of the Cartesian plane

        • Q3

          int Q3
          Orientation facing third quadrant of the Cartesian plane

        • Q4

          int Q4
          Orientation facing forth quadrant of the Cartesian plane

    • Class gameComponents.OpticalObject extends GameComponent implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -7410094189258732759L

      • Serialized Fields

        • normalLine

          LineEq normalLine
          The normal line is the line perpendicular to a surface hit by a ray of light

          double inclination
          The slope of the axis of this optical object

    • Class gameComponents.Prism extends Lens implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -8098103115950079854L

      • Serialized Fields

        • shape

          java.awt.Polygon shape
          We use a polygon type, but the shape will always be triangular

        • side

          double side
          The length of the sides of the equilateral triangle representing this prism object

        • vertex1

          java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double vertex1
          The first vertex of the triangular shape

        • vertex2

          java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double vertex2
          The second vertex of the triangular shape

        • vertex3

          java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double vertex3
          The third vertex of the triangular shape

        • line1

          LineEq line1
          The line segment between vertices 1 and 2

        • line2

          LineEq line2
          The line segment between vertices 2 and 3

        • line3

          LineEq line3
          The line segment between vertices 3 and 1

        • angle

          double angle
          The angle of rotation of this prism

    • Class gameComponents.Ray extends GameComponent implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -7964894323816186059L

      • Serialized Fields

        • path

          java.util.ArrayList<E> path
          Contains the points that trace the trajectory of this ray

        • hitComponent

          java.util.ArrayList<E> hitComponent
          Contains the indices of the components, in the list passed to the impact method, that were hit by this Ray object; i.e. hitComponent.get(i) contains the index of the component hit by the ith point in the path

        • on

          boolean on
          Tells if the light ray is on or off

        • angle

          double angle
          The orientation of the first segment of the ray

        • radius

          double radius
          The radius of the light source, represented by a circular shape

        • h

          double h
          The x coordinate of the center of the circular shape of this light source, called h by convention

        • k

          double k
          The y coordinate of the center of the circular shape of this light source, called k by convention

    • Class gameComponents.RefractiveZone extends OpticalObject implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -4747016761271858698L

      • Serialized Fields

        • refractionIndex

          double refractionIndex
          This index determines how much a ray is bent when it enters the refractive zone; values between 1.0 and 5.0

        • outerIndex

          double outerIndex
          The refraction index of the zone surrounding this refractive zone. Value of 1.0 if it is not nested in another zone

        • width

          int width
          Width of the rectangular shape of this refractive zone

        • height

          int height
          Height of the rectangular shape of this refractive zone

          insure that the leave alert box is only displayed once

          constant representing the answer of the user to the alert dialog

          constant representing the answer of the user to the alert dialog

        • cancel

          int cancel
          constant representing the answer of the user to the alert dialog

    • Class userInterface.Lab extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -7872169687505709389L

      • Serialized Fields

        • BIG

          double BIG

        • MARKERSIZE

          int MARKERSIZE

        • scrollPaneSize

          int scrollPaneSize

        • w

          int w
          width of the panel

        • h

          int h
          height of the panel

        • scale

          double scale

        • scaling

          boolean scaling

        • timer

          javax.swing.Timer timer
          timer used for animation when the camera view changes

        • componentIndex

          int componentIndex
          the index of the component's marker that was clicked

        • prevMouseX

          int prevMouseX
          stores the previous x coordinate of the mouse pointer position on the panel

        • prevMouseY

          int prevMouseY
          stores the previous y coordinate of the mouse pointer position on the panel

        • diffX

          double diffX
          difference between the previous and current x coordinate of the mouse pointer

        • diffY

          double diffY
          difference between the previous and current y coordinate of the mouse pointer

        • countX

          int countX
          counts the number of times the camera view has been moved in x direction during an animation

        • countY

          int countY
          counts the number of times the camera view has been moved in y direction during an animation

        • selectionRec

          java.awt.geom.RectangularShape selectionRec
          the rectangle enclosing an area to select components

        • originalPos

          java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double originalPos
          the position where the user first clicked to make a selection rectangle

        • endPos

          java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double endPos
          the position where the user released the mouse button to make a selection rectangle

        • keyHeldCount

          int keyHeldCount
          counts the number of iterations during which a key is held down

        • overComp

          boolean overComp
          tells whether the mouse is over a component or not

        • draggingComp

          boolean draggingComp
          tells whether the user is dragging a component or not

        • resizingRectanle

          boolean resizingRectanle
          tells whether the user is resizing a rectangle or not

        • beingResized

          int beingResized
          stores the index of the component currently being resized

        • overMarker

          boolean overMarker
          tells whether the cursor is over a marker or not

        • overScrollPane

          boolean overScrollPane
          tells whether the cursor is over the scroll pane or not

        • changingView

          boolean changingView
          tells whether the user is currently changing the camera view or not

        • backupFile

          java.io.File backupFile
          contains the current state of the game

        • released

          java.util.ArrayList<E> released
          for each active components, at the corresponding index, it tells whether that component is currently being dragged or not

        • markers

          java.util.ArrayList<E> markers
          contains the positions of the markers markers can be clicked to move the camera view to the corresponding component in the plane a marker is only displayed if the corresponding component is out of the camera view

        • activeComponents

          java.util.ArrayList<E> activeComponents
          contains all the game component objects that are active on the plane

        • availableComponents

          java.util.ArrayList<E>[] availableComponents
          contains lists of components that are available to the user

        • scrollPanel

          ScrollPanel scrollPanel
          the panel displaying available components from this panel, the user can bring in new active components

        • jSPComponents

          javax.swing.JScrollPane jSPComponents

        • scrollContainer

          javax.swing.JPanel scrollContainer

        • gm

          GameMenu gm
          menu icon from which the user can access the game menu
